work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Honorable Mentions - Student Game Competition CHI 2024

publications.name: AnnoPlot: Interactive Visualizations of Text Annotations
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 18th Conference of the European Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: System Demonstrations

publications.name: Language of Zelda: Facilitating Language Learning Practices Using ChatGPT
publications.publisher: Extended Abstracts of the CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI EA '24)

projects.name: Interactive Annotation Data Visualization Tool
projects.summary: A tool that allows interactive user manipulation of the embedding space.
highlights: Supervised by Dr. Cris Biemann and Tim Fischer

projects.name: The Language of Zelda
projects.summary: ChatGPT agent based language learning game prototype.
highlights: Supervised by Dr. Frank Steinicke and Sukran Karaosmanoglu

projects.name: Historical Language Modeling
projects.summary: Efficient pretraining of small language models for historical data isolation.
highlights: Supervised by Dr. Tom Lippincott and Dr. Craig Messner

projects.name: Legal Latin Handwriting Transcription
projects.summary: A handwriting transcriber for the low-resource field of Latin legal protocol.
highlights: Supervised by Dr. Tom Lippincott and Dr. Hale Sirin

projects.name: Solving NYT Connection
projects.summary: Evaluating a variety of approaches on the well-known New York Times Connection Puzzle.

projects.name: Continuous Time Embedding Topic Model
projects.summary: Adaptation of the dynamic Embedding Topic Model (DETM) to handle continuous time data.
